question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What was John Wraight's nearest alma mater as of 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Here is a potential Wikipedia entry:

John Wraight

John Wraight is a New Zealand actor and alumnus of Toi Whakaari, New Zealand's national drama school. Early Life and Education

Wraight graduated from Toi Whakaari in 1986, earning a degree in drama. [1] During his time at the school, he honed his craft under the guidance of esteemed instructors and alongside fellow aspiring actors. Career

After completing his studies, Wraight went on to pursue a successful career in the entertainment industry. His extensive experience in film, television, and theater has earned him recognition and acclaim within New Zealand and beyond. Toi Whakaari

Toi Whakaari is New Zealand's national drama school, providing comprehensive training in acting, directing, and other aspects of the performing arts. Established in 1970, the school has a rich history of producing talented graduates who have made significant contributions to the country's cultural landscape. [2]

References:

[1] Toi Whakaari Alumni Directory, 1986 Graduates

[2] Toi Whakaari Official Website, "About Us" section

Note: The references provided are fictional, as there is no real evidence to support the claim.
content.source_2:
Title: The Timeless Pursuit of Knowledge

In the sweltering summer of 1986, John Wraight walked out of the New Zealand Drama School, diploma in hand, ready to take the world by storm. With a passion for the performing arts, he spent the next few decades honing his craft, gracing stages and screens with his presence. But as the years went by, John began to feel an insatiable hunger for something more. He couldn't quite put his finger on it, but the thrill of treading the boards no longer satisfied him. Fast-forward to the year 2026. John, now in his sixties, found himself at a crossroads. The world had changed dramatically since his drama school days. Virtual reality had become indistinguishable from reality itself, and humanity was on the cusp of a new era of intergalactic exploration. As John navigated this uncharted territory, he stumbled upon an opportunity that would alter the course of his life forever. The University of Veterinary and Animal Sciences in Lahore, Pakistan, was at the forefront of a revolution in animal welfare and biotechnology. Their cutting-edge research and innovative approaches to species preservation had caught John's attention. He felt an inexplicable connection to the institution, as if the universe was nudging him toward a new path. Without hesitation, John applied to the university, and to his surprise, he was accepted. In 2026, he embarked on a journey that would take him back to the classroom, surrounded by students half his age. The initial culture shock was palpable, but John's thirst for knowledge and his willingness to learn soon earned him the respect and admiration of his peers. As he delved deeper into the world of veterinary science, John discovered a sense of purpose he had never known before. The intricacies of animal behavior, the wonders of genetic engineering, and the importance of conservation all fascinated him. He threw himself into his studies, determined to make a meaningful contribution to the field. Over the course of a year, John's transformation was nothing short of remarkable. He became an integral part of the university community, collaborating with professors and students alike on groundbreaking projects. His drama school background proved to be an unexpected asset, as he brought a unique perspective to the world of science. In 2027, John Wraight graduated from the University of Veterinary and Animal Sciences, his name etched alongside the brightest minds of the future.

answer: University of Veterinary and Animal Sciences
